intro: Monotagma surinamense, commonly known as the Surinam sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
